data.title: Islands in the Net by Bruce Sterling, First Edition
data.meta_description: Islands in the Net by Bruce Sterling and a great selection of related books, art and collectibles available now at AbeBooks.com.
data.text:
Cloth. Condition: Fine. Dust Jacket Condition: Near Fine. None (illustrator). First edition. A first edition copy of this science fiction work by Bruce Sterling, in the unclipped dust wrapper. First UK Edition, scarce edition.In the unclipped dust wrapper.'Islands in the Net' is a science fiction work by Bruce Sterling. Published in 1988, it is set in the year 2023 in a world where 'nuclear weapons, environmental crises and national politics are all things of the past'. Instead, a global telecommunications system provides friendship and support through economic democratic corporations.The main character's preconceptions start to change as she becomes aware of her company making deals with offshore data-pirates, as well as countries like Grenada and Singapore who still live with a work ethic, natural food, personal wealth, and the petrol engine.Bruce Sterling is an American science fiction writer. He is particularly linked to the cyberpunk genre, and is the co-editor of the Mirrorshades anthology.Collated, complete. In the publisher's original cloth binding, in the original unclipped dust wrapper. Externally, excellent. Dust wrapper is also excellent, with just a bit of edge wear particularly to the top spine region of wraps. Internally, firmly bound. Pages are very bright and clean throughout, with light age-toning to margins. Fine. book.

Cloth. Condition: Fine. Dust Jacket Condition: Very Good. Don Bolognese (illustrator). First Edition. Arbor House, New York 1988 - First Edition. Hardcover: white cloth and blue boards with gold lettering on spine. Fine tight, unread, nearly as new copy with very minor rubbing and shelf wear to DJ; hint of foxing on top of text block. Far-future, high-tech novel by one of founders of the "cyberpunk" movement. This copy is INSCRIBED "For John, Bruce Sterling, July 1988.". Signed by Author(s).

Octavo, cloth-backed boards. First edition. ". Sterling's novels may be seen as tours conducted around fields of data by protagonists whose main function is to witness them for us. This approach culminated in ISLANDS IN THE NET, a near-future thriller concerned with the increasing growth and complexity of political power in electronic communication networks." - Clute and Nicholls (eds), The Encyclopedia of Science Fiction (1993), pp. 1163-4. ". one of the most fascinating sociological and political SF novels in recent years." - Anatomy of Wonder (1995) 4-439 Winner of the 1989 John W. Campbell Award. 1989 Hugo nominee. Anatomy of Wonder (2004) II-1082. Sargent, British and American Utopian Literature, 1986-2009. A fine copy in fine dust jacket. (#114656).
